data.title: Personal Best
data.statement:
The puzzle input provides one or more gymnasts' names and competition categories, for example "{{Simone Biles}}" and "{{bars}}", following which will be a set of competition records. Each record contains a gymnast's name and the points they scored on the bars, the balance beam, and for floor work. There may be more than one competition record per gymnast.

The puzzle requires that you read through all the records, and find the highest score for each of the given gymnast/s in the given category/categories.

data.constraints:
1 ≤ [[N]] ≤ 40
6 ≤ [[bars]], [[beam]], [[floor]] < 10

Each of the gymnasts in [[gymnasts]] will always have their [[name]] included in the competition records.
Points scores ([[bars]], [[beam]], [[floor]]) will have between 0 and 2 decimal places, sometimes mixed.
data.stubGenerator:
read gymnasts:string(256)
read categories:string(32)
read N:int
loop N read row:string(256)
write 0.00
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> The names of one or more [[gymnasts]] for whom to provide a personal best, separated by a comma
<<Line 2:>> One or more [[categories]] for which to find the personal best, separated by a comma; these can be "{{bars}}", "{{beam}}", or "{{floor}}"
<<Line 3:>> An integer [[N]] for the number of competition records provided
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> One string and three floating point values, separated by a comma, representing a gymnast and the number of points they scored in each category. These values represent a gymnast's [[name]], and their score on the [[bars]], [[beam]], and [[floor]] work in a competition.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

The puzzle input provides one or more gymnasts' names and competition categories, for example "Simone Biles" and "bars", following which will be a set of competition records. Each record contains a gymnast's name and the points they scored on the bars, the balance beam, and for floor work. There may be more than one competition record per gymnast.

The puzzle requires that you read through all the records, and find the highest score for each of the given gymnast/s in the given category/categories.
Input
Line 1: The names of one or more gymnasts for whom to provide a personal best, separated by a comma
Line 2: One or more categories for which to find the personal best, separated by a comma; these can be "bars", "beam", or "floor"
Line 3: An integer N for the number of competition records provided
Next N lines: One string and three floating point values, separated by a comma, representing a gymnast and the number of points they scored in each category. These values represent a gymnast's name, and their score on the bars, beam, and floor work in a competition.
Output
One or more lines, each one a comma-separated list of the maximum points for the given gymnasts for the requested categories, in the same order.

For example, given the input:
Paris Berelc,Ariana Berlin
bars,floor

Then the order of the output would be:
bars score for Paris Berelc,floor score for Paris Berelc
bars score for Ariana Berlin,floor score for Ariana Berlin
Constraints
1 ≤ N ≤ 40
6 ≤ bars, beam, floor < 10

Each of the gymnasts in gymnasts will always have their name included in the competition records.
Points scores (bars, beam, floor) will have between 0 and 2 decimal places, sometimes mixed.
Example
Input
Simone Biles
floor
1
Simone Biles,8,7,9
Output
9
